intro: Ouratea pycnostachys, commonly known as the dense-stemmed ouratea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are typically followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
